dc:description.dcterms:abstract: The labelling is a key informational source for modern consumers because they take into account value parameters, quality characteristics of products, nutrition and energy values, “origin” of products, and such social aspects as ecological protection, recycling, etc.. However, the labelling is the element of the national food safety and quality control systems. It is also a commercial tool for food business operators. Taking into account the striving of the European countries to harmonize procedures of the labelling and protect consumers of fraud information, to simplify the access for business operators from third countries to the European markets, issues of the approximation of the labelling are still current importance. That is why the article includes a review of basic legislation in this sector of the EU, Italy, Germany, Russian Federation, EurAsEC and introduces Unified Food Labelling Module, suggested by authority.
